```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(here)
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
library(patchwork)
```

```{r}
#read in data
gas_tax <- read_csv(here("data", "HW3_data.csv")) %>% 
  clean_names()
```

```{r}
#find regression low income
ggplot(data = gas_tax, aes(x = price_dollars,
                              y = q_low_gallons)) +
  geom_line(colour = "green") +
  labs(x = "Number of Gallons($)",
       y = "Price ($/Gallon)",
       title = "Low Income Price Per Gallon Gasoline") +
  theme_minimal() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm",
              color = "black",
              size = 0.5,
              fill = "gray10",
              alpha = 0.5) +
  ggpubr::stat_regline_equation(label.x = 1, label.y = 0)
```

```{r}
#find regression high income
ggplot(data = gas_tax, aes(x = price_dollars,
                              y = q_high_gallons)) +
  geom_line(colour = "green") +
  labs(x = "Number of Gallons($)",
       y = "Price ($/Gallon)",
       title = "High Income Price Per Gallon Gasoline") +
  theme_minimal() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm",
              color = "black",
              size = 0.5,
              fill = "gray10",
              alpha = 0.5) +
  ggpubr::stat_regline_equation(label.x = 1, label.y = 0)
```
